title: Sunil Chhetri Is Back Fit As India Name Squad For World Cup Qualifier Against Bangladesh
text:
Indian football team have been handed a massive boost as captain Sunil Chhetri has been included in the 23-man squad for World Cup qualifier against Bangladesh after recovering from injury.

AFP

Head coach Igor Stimac named his squad on Saturday, and India was given a much needed lift after talisman Chhetri was declared fit enough to be part of the squad. Having missed the game against Asian champions Qatar, he will be back leading the line for the blues.

The 112 cap international, Chhetri will look to add to his 72 goals and look to given India the much needed three points.

IANS

Defenders Sandesh Jhingan and Anwar Ali (Jr) were ruled out the match to be played at VYBK, also known as the Salt Lake Stadium, due to injuries, while Halicharan Narzary, Farukh Choudhary and Nishu Kumar did not make it to the final 23 and were released from the national camp.

PTI

Seasoned defensive bulwark Jhingan suffered an Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL) tear on his left knee during the team's 1-1 draw against Guwahati-based North East United in a friendly on Wednesday and he will undergo a surgery that may rule him out for six months.

India currently lie fourth in the table after two games - having lost first game to Oman, and then drawing their other game against Qatar, which was a deserved point earned. With still six games to play, India are still in hunt for the the World Cup spot.

India will be buoyed by the presence of Sunil Chhetri and looking to post their first win of the qualifying stage.

With Inputs From PTI
